title: Are there differences between staff groups in reporting feeling pressure to work when unwell?
analysis_commentary: In line with staff reporting that they have been ill due to work related stress, the proportion of disabled staff who say that they felt pressure to attend work when ill is consistently greater than in staff who are not disabled. In 2014, 34% of disabled staff said that they felt pressure to work, compared to 20% of staff who are not disabled. This doubled in 2015, given the addition of the questions as to whether there was self-inflicted pressure to go to work when unwell.
